etymologies: so named because the wood was formerly used to make ‘dogs’ (i.e. skewers)

definitions: a shrub or small tree of north temperate regions, which yields hard timber and is grown for its decorative foliage, red stems, or colorful berries.

notes.text: Genus Cornus, family Cornaceae: many species, including the flowering dogwood (C. florida), common to the eastern US

shortDefinitions: shrub or small tree of north temperate regions

definitions: used in names of trees which resemble the dogwood or yield similar hard timber.
shortDefinitions: used in names of trees which resemble dogwood or yield similar hard timber
